item.title: 代表称欧佩克+将批准 12 月小幅增加产量
item.description: 据与会代表称，"欧佩克+"成员国将在周日晚些时候举行的在线会议上同意在 12 月份再次小幅提高产量。【原文：OPEC+ members are set to sign off on another small output hike for December when they meet online later Sunday, according to delegates.】

item.title: 英国债券两年来最佳表现赢得全球投资者青睐
item.description: 对于英国债券市场来说，10 月份是一个不同寻常的好月份。【原文：October was an unusually good month for the UK bond market.】

item.title: 香港财政总监称香港将实现全年增长目标
item.description: 财政司司长陈茂波在每周博客中写道，香港有望实现今年的经济增长目标。【原文：Hong Kong is poised to achieve its goal for economic growth this year, Financial Secretary Paul Chan wrote in his weekly blog.】

item.title: Nexperia 中国公司称尽管供应中断但库存充足
item.description: 尽管荷兰半导体公司 Nexperia BV 的母公司暂停了对其组装厂的供应，但该公司在中国的分公司仍储备了足够的晶圆来满足客户的订单。【原文：The Chinese unit of Nexperia BV, a Dutch semiconductor company, has enough wafers stockpiled to fill orders for its customers, despite its parent company’s suspension of supplies to its assembly plant.】

item.title: 黑海港口遭无人机袭击，俄罗斯油轮被烧毁
item.description: 乌克兰无人机的袭击导致一艘油轮起火，并损坏了俄罗斯黑海港口图阿普谢的石油装卸设施，该港口是俄罗斯石油公司（Rosneft）一家重要炼油厂的所在地。【原文：A Ukrainian drone attack set an oil tanker ablaze and damaged oil-loading facilities in Russia’s Black Sea port of Tuapse, home to a key Rosneft refinery.】

item.title: 沙特化工巨头扭亏为盈
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯最大的化工公司报告盈利，结束了连续三个季度的亏损，这表明该公司在与长期的行业低迷作斗争方面正在取得进展。【原文：Saudi Arabia’s biggest chemical company reported a profit to snap a string of three straight quarterly losses, in a sign it is making progress in battling through a prolonged industry downturn.】

item.title: 马克里称米莱的阿根廷内阁首脑人选是个错误
item.description: 阿根廷前总统毛里西奥-马克里（Mauricio Macri）说，阿根廷领导人哈维尔-米莱（Javier Milei）不应该选择曼努埃尔-阿多尼（Manuel Adorni）担任内阁首脑，这表明在上周的中期选举之后，盟友之间的紧张关系仍在持续。【原文：Argentinian leader Javier Milei should not have chosen Manuel Adorni as cabinet chief, former President Mauricio Macri said, signaling tensions continue to simmer among the allies after last week’s mid-term election.】

item.title: 中国抨击日本高市与台湾林全会面
item.description: 中国批评日本首相高市真奈在亚太经济合作组织峰会期间与台湾官员会面，以及她随后在社交媒体上发布的有关讨论的帖子。【原文：China criticized Japan’s Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi for meeting with Taiwan officials on the sidelines of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation summit and her subsequent social media posts about the discussions.】

item.title: 胜利巨人飙升 600% 凸显中美科技合作
item.description: 虽然中美两国在关税和贸易限制方面的冲突一直是科技界的主旋律，但今年最热门的亚洲股票表明，中美两国仍然相互依赖。【原文：While clashes between the US and China over tariffs and trade restrictions have been a dominant theme in the technology world, this year’s hottest Asian stock demonstrates how the nations still rely on each other.】

item.title: 巴西 Azul 公司称与无担保债权人达成协议
item.description: Azul SA 表示，该公司与代表该公司无担保债权人的委员会就一项计划达成协议，以推进巴西航空公司在美国申请破产后的财务重组。【原文：Azul SA said it reached an agreement with a committee representing the company’s unsecured creditors on a plan to advance the Brazilian airline’s financial restructuring following a bankruptcy filing in the US.】

item.title: 英国央行将维持利率不变，英国预算案成为决定性因素
item.description: 预计英国央行周四将不降息，进一步放慢一年多来保持的每季度一次的宽松政策步伐。【原文：The Bank of England is expected to skip an interest-rate cut on Thursday, further slowing the once-a-quarter pace to policy easing that it’s maintained for more than a year.】

item.title: 埃及耗资 10 亿美元的大博物馆揭幕，作为 "献给世界的礼物
item.description: 埃及举行了期待已久的耗资 10 亿美元的博物馆落成典礼，该博物馆展示了埃及古老历史的奇迹，并将为这个北非国家至关重要的旅游业注入新的活力。【原文：Egypt inaugurated a long-anticipated $1 billion museum that showcases the wonders of its ancient past and is poised to supercharge the North African nation’s crucial tourism sector.】

item.title: 欧佩克+讨论聚焦 12 月石油产量小幅增长
item.description: 据三位代表称，欧佩克+成员国倾向于在周日举行的在线会议之前再次小幅增加 12 月份的产量。【原文：OPEC+ members are leaning towards another small production increase for December ahead of an online meeting on Sunday, according to three delegates.】

item.title: 企业僵尸队伍正在壮大信贷周刊
item.description: 本周末，各式各样的万圣节怪物涌入社区，寻找糖果和派对，信贷市场也看到了另一种僵尸的复活。【原文：As Halloween monsters of all stripes flood neighborhoods in search of candy and parties this weekend, credit markets are seeing the resurgence of a different type of zombie.】

item.title: 特朗普特使称叙利亚领导人将于本月访问华盛顿
item.description: 据美国驻大马士革特使称，叙利亚领导人艾哈迈德-沙拉将于本月访问华盛顿特区，并有望与唐纳德-特朗普总统会面，签署正式加入全球反恐联盟的协议。【原文：Syria’s leader Ahmed Al-Sharaa will visit Washington DC this month and is expected to meet President Donald Trump to sign an agreement to formally join a global anti-terror coalition, according to the US special envoy to Damascus.】

item.title: 大规模集会纪念震撼塞尔维亚的悲痛和抗议之年
item.description: 数万人在塞尔维亚城市诺维萨德游行，纪念火车站致命事件一周年，该事件在震撼巴尔干国家的一年里引发了反政府抗议浪潮，加剧了政治紧张局势，加深了分裂。【原文：Tens of thousands marched through the Serbian city of Novi Sad to mark the anniversary of a fatal train station incident that has spawned a wave of anti-government protests, fueled political tensions and deepened divisions in the year since it rocked the Balkan country.】

item.title: 米尔顿-弗里德曼最后的芝加哥男孩对哈维尔-米莱的警告
item.description: 哈维尔-米莱（Javier Milei）大步走上圣地亚哥的舞台，高举双臂，向一位坐在前排的经济学家鞠躬致意：罗尔夫-吕德斯（Rolf Lüders），最后一批芝加哥男孩之一。【原文：Javier Milei strode onto the stage in Santiago, flung up his arms and gave a bow to an economist with a front-row seat: Rolf Lüders, one of the last of the original Chicago Boys.】

item.title: 贝莱德旗下恒生银行清偿不良贷款后信贷欺诈隐忧重重
item.description: 贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc. ）斥资 120 亿美元收购 HPS 投资合伙公司（HPS Investment Partners）的交易墨迹未干，这家私人信贷巨头的高管们就意识到他们的一项投资出了大问题。【原文：The ink was barely dry on BlackRock Inc.’s $12 billion acquisition of HPS Investment Partners when executives at the private credit giant realized one of their investments had gone horribly wrong.】

item.title: 大型科技公司财报揭示大规模人工智能支出的漏洞
item.description: 本周，美联储下调了利率，数十家美国公司公布了财报，但这一切都归结为一个主题：人工智能。【原文：A week that saw the Federal Reserve cut interest rates and dozens of US companies report earnings nevertheless boiled down to a single theme: artificial intelligence.】

item.description: 伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway Inc.【原文：Berkshire Hathaway Inc.’s cash pile soared to $381.7 billion in the third quarter, a fresh record, and operating earnings at Chief Executive Officer Warren Buffett’s conglomerate surged 34%.】

item.title: 基金经理罕见地为 Lenskart 印度首次公开募股投资辩护
item.description: 印度资产管理公司 DSP Asset Managers Pvt.在社交媒体上对 Lenskart Solutions Ltd.首次公开募股的估值引起轩然大波后，为自己购买该公司股票的行为进行了辩护。【原文：In an unusual move for an Indian asset manager, DSP Asset Managers Pvt. defended its purchase of shares in Lenskart Solutions Ltd.’s initial public offering, following a social media furor over its valuations.】

item.title: 尼日利亚丹格特公司称燃料产量现已超过当地需求
item.description: 尼日利亚的巨型丹格特炼油厂表示，它现在生产的汽油和柴油超过了当地的消费量，因为它支持西非国家对成品油征收 15%进口税的提议。【原文：Nigeria’s giant Dangote refinery says it now produces more gasoline and diesel than can be consumed locally, as it backed a proposal by the West African nation to impose a 15% import duty on refined products.】

item.title: 中国还有一个贸易武器在等着美国
item.description: 美国需要担心的不仅仅是稀土。还有药品。【原文：It’s not just rare earths the US has to worry about. It’s pharmaceuticals, too.】

item.title: 土耳其最大城市通胀率在全国数据公布前上升
item.description: 伊斯坦布尔的零售通胀率略有上升，表明在周一公布 10 月份全国数据之前，土耳其的物价压力依然强劲。【原文：Retail inflation ticked up in Istanbul, indicating that price pressures in Turkey remained strong ahead of national data for October that’s expected on Monday.】

item.title: 几内亚在修订预算中预计 2025 年经济增长率将达 7.2
item.description: 预算部长法西内特-西拉（Facinet Sylla）表示，几内亚经济预计到2025年底将增长7.2%，略高于最初预测的7%。【原文：Guinea’s economy is expected to grow 7.2% by the end of 2025, slightly above the 7% initially forecast, Budget Minister Facinet Sylla said.】

item.title: 绘制全球经济图表：美联储抑制降息预期
item.description: 北美两个最大经济体的央行行长本周降低了借贷成本，尽管在美国联邦储备委员会和加拿大央行行长抑制了年底前进一步降低借贷成本的预期后，政府债务收益率攀升。【原文：Central bankers in North America’s two largest economies lowered borrowing costs this week, though yields on government debt climbed after the heads of US Federal Reserve and the Bank of Canada damped expectations for further reductions by year-end.】

item.title: 卡尼称加拿大无法立即取消对华关税
item.description: 加拿大总理马克-卡尼（Mark Carney）表示，立即采取行动降低中国对加拿大商品（如油菜籽）征收的关税从来都不是他周五与中国国家主席习近平会晤的现实结果。【原文：Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney said immediate action to reduce Chinese tariffs on Canadian goods such as canola was never a realistic outcome for his Friday meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping.】

item.title: 拉弗解释他的著名曲线如何帮助英国
item.description: 你交的税太多了。几乎每个人都是如此。这是阿瑟-拉弗（Arthur Laffer）的观点，他早在 1974 年就绘制了一条曲线，显示了他对税率和税收之间关系的看法，这条曲线现在被称为 "拉弗曲线"。【原文：You are paying too much tax. Pretty much everyone is. That’s the view of Arthur Laffer, the man who, back in 1974, drew the curve showing his take on the relationship between tax rates and tax revenue now known as the Laffer Curve.】
